content.description: A recent addition to the Tall Wall, 'Tall T' was put up by Tim Standing in 2007. The route starts 10 feet right of 'Banana Split', by intially climbing somewhat loose flakes to the open slab above. Most find the crux in between bolts 3 and 4, as one makes delicate friction moves on "kitty litter".
content.location: In addition to the description above, a variation exists (not shown in the current 'Bishop Area Rock Climbs' guide book) by initially climbing 'Banana Split' (the crack/seam which starts just left of Tall T) to its first bolt then traverse up and right, clipping a bolt underneath a buldge. Continue upward to the fourth bolt of 'Tall T'. This variation can be protected with small nuts (optional) after clipping the first bolt.

content.description: Follow the arete, then move left to the anchors.
content.location: On the arete/face to the right of the tallest face on the Tall Wall. Lower Off.

content.description: Long route up the left side of the formation. Bolt count is approximate - bring extra draws.

climbs.name: Lives of the Cowboys
climbs.fa: B. Bindner and E. Holland  October 2008. (P1 G.U., P2 T.D.)

content.description:
Pitch 1: An awkward entry move establishes you in a chimney. After thrutching upward for a bit, step out onto the steep left wall and climb up until the angle eases. The belay is on the left.

Pitch 2: Continue up low angle slab to a steep wall. Climb this, moving up and right, to a lower angle slab. Follow this to the belay ledge.

Descent: two 25m rappels (from Mussy Hooks) return to the ground.
content.location: Walk left (south) along the base of Tall Wall from Rotten Bannanas until you encounter a low angle slab leading up to a bolted slot. This is the route, which follow a thin dike for two pitches.

content.description: Climb bolt-protected dihedral that follows the gear protected crack up left after the fourth bolt.
content.protection: Four bolts protect the bottom, finger-sized gear protects the top. Mussey hook anchor.
content.location: On the backside of the Tall wall, just to the left of Diamondblade, a striking 5.12a face climb.

content.description: Strikingly aesthetic face climb up high quality rock. Cruxes are well protected, and the movement is quite fun. The holds are all there, just not always as big as you'd like them to be...
content.location: Just to the right of Dream on, a 5.10b dihedral.

content.description:
A bouldery start with fun body positioning pulls a bulge then climbs the face above.

Marty Lewis' guide calls this 10a, but I went ahead and upgraded it here to 10b since it looked like some holds may have broken off the start. In fact, I took a fun little whipper off the 1st bolt when a hold I was using came off in my hand.
content.location: Around the right side of The Tall Wall. Scramble over a couple boulders. This climb starts down and right of Back Trail.

content.description: Long route up right side of formation.
To the right of "Bananarama", climb seams and face, passing a bolt, and the obvious wide crack. Move up and right from near the cracks top to anchors.
Start up a ramp to lieback crack.  Follow bolts which transition to the face and bolted anchors.
content.location: Just right of 'Banana Hammock'.  Bolts right of the fist sized crack.

content.description:
Has a little bit of chess but overall has some good movement on good holds

Might be a little softer then 11a....maybe more like 10c
content.location: This is the route just to the left of Rotten Bananas

content.description: Good rock quality for the Alabama Hills with a move towards the top that will make aspiring 5.6 leaders pause.
content.location: Around the right side of The Tall Wall. Scramble over some boulders and this climb will be the first one you come to on your left. Start on top of a boulder.
